<<I already made Unix Series 1 but I need to continue
to the next pack because if you read the Unix Guide it
says that Jarketa was raised with other people from
his army by a strong cleric and at the end he is still
alive, only Charles' castle is dismantled but no one
is dead and I need some ideas. The only thing I know
about the next series is more of the Orcian Empire.
Maybe you can help.>>

Umm... I missed something. Where is this plot coming
from, and what is Unix Series 1?

<<Sorry for posting the hacking thing, but anyone
still interested in a Gladiator tournament by now
isn't going to cheat ( or at least I don't think so..?
maybe im wrong ) and plus, what is going to be done
about Boost? i mean, i guess it is mildly obvious,
but.. ok. i'm sorry. do you have adminstrative
properties to remove it or something?>>

I have never been able to make Boost work on the
modern version of Gladiator. Am I alone in this?

<<In my eternal quest to find out how things work, i
have come across a problem... how does Levels.001
work? I figure that its a compilation
of all the .fss files, and Graphics.001 is a
compilation of all the .pix files.. but... what?
Opening it in a hex or text editor gives a bunch of
values.... Anyway, is there anyway to unpack or
re-pack these files? that would be a superb feature of
a VB level editor.>>

"Gladpack" can make .001 files, and "Unpack" can
extract stuff from .001 files... I've been meaning to
make master versions of the Levels.001 and
Graphics.001 once we've worked out what are "accepted"
fan-made scenarios and what the titles will be.
Unfortunately, you can't add to a .001 file, so first
you need to unpack all the old stuff and make entirely
new Graphics.001 and Levels.001 files, and there are a
LOT of graphics files that can only be extracted one
at a time.

A file called "Dayofdra.mod" is mentioned somewhere in
the mysterious level 88 (I think that's the level,
anyhow, and it doesn't work on modern Gladiator--it
references graphics that don't exist), but isn't in
the packed .001 files... any ideas what this is all
about?

I apologise for not being very active in the groups
lately, but I'm no coder... I'd much rather work with
scenarios using the programs than work on the programs
using crazy languages... I hope you understand. I'm
also quite busy. But I am still listening, and I hope
the TevFifty will stay a part of Gladiator. I am still
willing to help with stuff, as long as it's not time-sensitive...
